data.title: Project MUSE
data.text:
Works Cited

Scholarly and Critical Works Cited

Althusser, Louis. "Ideology and Ideological State Apparatuses." Trans. Ben Brewster. Critical Theory since 1965. Ed. Hazard Adams and Leroy Searle. Tallahassee: UP of Florida and Florida State UP, 239-50.

Arnold, Andrew. "The Transgressive Comix of Kim Deitch." Time.com. 27 Sept. 2002. <http://www.time.com/time/arts/article/0,8599,355412,00.html>. 29 June 2012.

Aspen: The Multimedia Magazine in a Box. Adapted for the Web by Andrew Stafford. Ubu Web, [2002]. <http://www.ubu.com/aspen/>. 10 Aug. 2012.

Bader, Barbara. American Picture Books from Noah's Ark to the Beast Within. New York: Macmillan, 1976.

Bakis, Maureen. The Graphic Novel Classroom. Thousand Oaks, CA: Corwin, 2012.

Barnacle Press Comics 1.0: Comic Supplement. N.d. <http://www.barnaclepress.com/comics/>. 16 Sept. 2012.

Barnett, Mac, et al. "Proclamation!" [Oct. 2011]. <http://www.thepicturebook.co/>. 4 Aug. 2012.

Barthes, Roland. "The Death of the Author." Aspen (1967): 5-6.

———. S/Z. Trans. Richard Miller. New York: Hill and Wang, 1974.

Benjamin, Walter. "The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction." 1936. Trans. Harry Zohn. Illuminations: Essays and Reflections. Rev. ed. Ed. Hannah Arendt. New York: Shocken Books, 2007. 217-51. Also available on the Marxists Internet Archive, rev. Feb. 2005. <http://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ge/benjamin.htm>. 29 June 2012.

Beronä, David A. Wordless Books: The Original Graphic Novels. New York: Abrams, 2008.

Bohn, William. The Dada Market: An Anthology of Poetry. Carbondale: Southern Illinois UP, 1993.

Bordwell, David. "The Idea of Montage in Soviet Art and Film." Cinema Journal 11.2 (1972): 9-17.

Braudy, Leo, and Marshall Cohen, eds. Film Theory and Criticism. Rev. 7th ed. New York: Oxford UP, 2009. [End Page 489]

Carter, James Bucky, ed. Building Literacy Connections with Graphic Novels. Urbana, IL: NCTE, 2007.

Cartoon Image Database. The Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum, n.d. The Ohio State University Libraries. <https://cartoonimages.osu.edu/>. 10 Aug. 2012.

Cary, Stephen. Going Graphic: Comics at Work in the Multilingual Classroom. Portsmouth, NH: Heinemann, 2004.

Chute, Hillary. "Comics as Literature?: Reading Graphic Narrative." PMLA 123.2 (2008): 452-65.

———. "Comics Form and Narrating Lives." Profession 2011. New York: MLA, 2011. 107-17.

———. Graphic Women: Life Narrative & Contemporary Comics. New York: Columbia UP, 2010.

Delany, Samuel. Shorter Views: Queer Thoughts & the Politics of the Paraliterary. Hanover, NH: Wesleyan UP, 1999.

Devitt, Amy J. Writing Genres. 2004. Carbondale: Southern Illinois UP, 2008.

Eisner, Will. Comics & Sequential Art. 1985. Tamarac, FL: Poorhouse P, 2001.

Fishelov, David. "The Structure of Generic Categories: Some Cognitive Aspects." Journal of Literary Semantics 24.2 (1995): 117-26.

Fiske, John. Television Culture. London: Routledge, 1987.

Frye, Northrop. Anatomy of Criticism. 1957. Princeton, NJ: Princeton UP, 2000.

Genette, Gérard. The Architext: An Introduction. Trans. Jane E. Lewin. Berkeley: U of California P, 1992.

———. Paratexts: Thresholds of Interpretation. Trans. Jane E. Lewin. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1997.

Gill, Eric. An Essay on Typography. 1931; rev. 1936. Boston: Godine, 1988.

Groensteen, Thierry. The System of Comics. Trans. Bart Beaty and Nick Nguyen. Jackson: UP of Mississippi, 2007.

———. "Why Are Comics Still in Search of Cultural Legitimization?" 2000. Heer and Worcester, 3-11.

Haines, Robert. "Red: A Haida Manga by Michael Nicoll Yahgulanaas." The Joe Shuster Awards. 22 Feb. 2010. <http://joeshusterawards.com/2010/02/22/red-a-haida-manga/>. 1 Aug. 2012.

Hamilton, Ian. Keepers of the Flame: Literary Estates and the Rise of Biography. London: Faber & Faber, 1994.

Harvey, Robert C. "How Comics Came to Be: Through the Juncture of Word and Image from Magazine Gag Cartoons to Newspaper Strips, Tools for Critical Appreciation plus Rare Seldom Witnessed Historical Facts." Heer and Worcester, 25-45.

Hatfield, Charles. Alternative Comics: An Emerging Literature. Jackson: UP of Mississippi, 2005.

———. "Comic Art, Children's Literature, and the New Comics Studies." The Lion and the Unicorn 30.3 (2006): 360-82. [End Page 490]

———. "Graphic Novel." Keywords for Children's Literature. Ed. Philip Nel and Lissa Paul. New York: NYU P, 2011. 100-105.

———. "Narrative vs. Non-narrative Demands: Comic Art and Fragmentation in Aliki's How a Book Is Made." Children's Literature Association Quarterly 30.1 (2005): 88-99.

Heer, Jeet, and...
